entries.author: gabor_szabo
entries.text: In this virtual event you will learn how to use Markdown and GitHub Pages to create a simple web site and then we'll extend our use of GitHub Actions to generate the site using Perl. Register now!
entries.title: GitHub Pages for Perl developers (Free Virtual presentation on August 15)

Outreachy 2024 - Success working on the Open Food Facts project

entries.author: mohammad_anwar
entries.text: Welcome to a new week with a couple of fun tasks "Complete Day" and "Maximum Frequency". If you are new to the weekly challenge then why not join us and have fun every week. For more information, please read the FAQ.
entries.title: The Weekly Challenge - 276

entries.author: mohammad_anwar
entries.text: Enjoy a quick recap of last week's contributions by Team PWC dealing with the "Broken Keys" and "Replace Digits" tasks in Perl and Raku. You will find plenty of solutions to keep you busy.
entries.title: RECAP - The Weekly Challenge - 275

entries.author: arne_sommer
entries.text: Once again Raku is showing its regex power, incredible. Keep it up great work.
entries.title: Broken Digits

entries.author: jaldhar_vyas
entries.text: Keeping it simple with the use of builtin functions, very smart move. Well done.
entries.title: Perl Weekly Challenge: Week 275

entries.author: jorg_sommrey
entries.text: Perl regex is unbeatable. It gives plenty of choices to solve an issue. Thanks for sharing.
entries.title: Replacing the Broken Keys

entries.author: laurent_rosenfeld
entries.text: Near identical solutions in Perl and Raku. On top, we get detailed discussion. Highly recommended.
entries.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 275: Replace Digits

entries.author: luis_mochan
entries.text: If you are looking serious one liner in Perl then you reached the right place. Highly recommended.
entries.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 275

entries.author: luca_ferrari
entries.text: Extended power of Raku regex in display and laid out beautifully. Thank you for your contributions.
entries.title: pipelines!

entries.author: matthias_muth
entries.text: Step-by-step discussion is the highlight and makes it so easy to follow the logic. Great work.
entries.title: Broken Keys and Test Driven Understanding

entries.author: packy_anderson
entries.text: Regex is in demand irrespective of what programming language we pick. Nice to see, how you deal with them. Well done.
entries.title: Digitally Replace Broken Keys

entries.author: peter_campbell_smith
entries.text: DIY tool with detailed task analysis is bonus. You are going to love it, I am confident.
entries.title: Broken digits

entries.author: reinier_maliepaard
entries.text: Nearly one-liner, well formed chained methods. Great job, keep it up.
entries.title: The Weekly Challenge - 275

entries.author: robbie_hatley
entries.text: Keep it sweet and simple, is the approach taken this week. Nice, keep sharing.
entries.title: The Weekly Challenge #275

entries.author: roger_bell_west
entries.text: My personal favourite PostScript is one of the language showing the workings. Thank you for your contributions as always.
entries.title: Broken Digits

entries.author: simon_green
entries.text: The post is full of Python magics. I love the end result too. Well done.
entries.title: Broken digits

chapters.header: The Weekly Challenge by Mohammad Sajid Anwar will help you step out of your comfort-zone. You can even win prize money of $50 by participating in the weekly challenge. We pick one champion at the end of the month from among all of the contributors during the month, thanks to the sponsor Lance Wicks.
chapters.title: The Weekly Challenge

entries.text: The playlist
entries.title: TPRC 2024 - Las Vegas, Nevada

entries.author: gabor_szabo
entries.text: In this virtual event you will learn why and how to use GitHub Actions as a CI system for your Perl projects. The meeting is free of charge thanks to my supporters via Patreon and GitHub. Besides this event I am running many more, so make sure you check the Code Mavens meetup group and also register to it.
entries.title: Continuous Integration (CI): GitHub Actions for Perl Projects (Free Virtual presentation on July 14)

header: TPRC 2024 has ended and the videos are now available. Enjoy!
Oh and now that it is over, you can also register to the two virtual events I am running: Continuous Integration (CI): GitHub Actions for Perl Projects and GitHub Pages for Perl developers .
subject: Videos from TPRC 2024 - Las Vegas, Nevada
